title: Elliott and Vista Near Deal to Buy Citrix Systems
sub_head: Pair to pay $104 a share in cash for the cloud-computing company
body:
Cloud-computing company Citrix Systems Inc. is close to a deal to be taken private, continuing a spate of big leveraged buyouts.
Elliott Management Corp.â€™s private-equity arm, Evergreen Coast Capital, and Vista Equity Partners are near an agreement to pay $104 a share, or roughly $13 billion, for the software company, according to people familiar with the matter.
